artist: Artist: Yoshida Hiroshi (self-published); Carver: Maeda Yūjirō
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: Mt. Fuji, partially covered in snow in background, silhouettes of trees in middle ground; reflection of Mt. Fuji in river in foreground
inscription: left: 昭和三年作　ふじさん夕 {Shōwa sannen saku, Fujisan yū} | bottom, in pencil: Fujiyama from Suzukawa | H. Yoshida
markings: LLC, red artist\'s seal I: 博 {Hiroshi}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Fuji in the Evening
